    • Method Detail

      • getHealth

        public double getHealth()
        Description copied from interface: HasHealth
        Returns the percentage of remaining health, where a value of 1.0 represents getMaxHealth(). Percentages must always be greater than or equal to zero. To calculate the remaining health as a value: remainingHealth = getHealth() * getMaxHealth() Note: Percentages above 1.0 are valid and represent a temporary health boost above getMaxHealth()
        Specified by:
        getHealth in interface HasHealth
        Returns:
        percentage - the percentage of remaining health

      • getMaxHealth

        public double getMaxHealth()
        Description copied from interface: HasHealth
        Returns the maximum health. Must be greater than 0. Note: It is possible to go over the maximum health when getHealth() returns a value greater than 1.0. This case represents a temporary health boost.
        Specified by:
        getMaxHealth in interface HasHealth
        Returns:
        maxHealth - the "maximum" health

      • setHealth

        public void setHealth(double percentage)
        Description copied from interface: HasHealth
        Sets the percentage of remaining health irrespective of any defense or healing bonuses. Sets the percentage of remaining health (see getHealth()) without taking defense or healing bonuses into account. Percentages must always be greater than or equal to zero. Do not use this method to damage or heal the object. Instead, implement the HasCombat interface and use a HealthEffect.
        Specified by:
        setHealth in interface HasHealth
        Parameters:
        percentage - - the percentage of remaining health

      • applyEffect

        public void applyEffect(HealthEffect effect)
        Description copied from interface: HasCombat
        Apply a health effect. Defense and healing bonuses are taken into account.
        Specified by:
        applyEffect in interface HasCombat
        Parameters:
        effect - - the HealthEffect object

      • isDead

        public boolean isDead()
        Description copied from interface: HasHealth
        Returns true if the object is in a dead state (usually corresponding to when getHealth is equal to zero). Otherwise returns false.
        Specified by:
        isDead in interface HasHealth
        Returns:
        - boolean

      • kill

        public void kill()
        Description copied from interface: HasHealth
        Puts the object into a dead state. See isDead()
        Specified by:
        kill in interface HasHealth
